title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 26 [december 1867]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 26 [December 1867]
text: Dec. '67thursdayThursday 26thMy dear Walti received your letter with the 5 dollerdollars all first rate and i should have wrote yesterday but i went down to mattsMatt's for the first i had not been down to their place before) george came home yesterday morning thinks likely he will stay till after new year sNew Year's as something in the foundry is broken and will take time to be repairdrepaired george dontdon't know as he will be there much longer but will be employed in brooklynBrooklyn) we are about the same as usual matty and the children are going back with jeff after taking the place and getting the things unpacked they have fairly decided to return with him she dontdon't like her place at all and would move again if she staidstayed so she thinks she had better go at once as jeff is under a very great expenceexpense i wontwon't write much walt or i shantshan't have any thing to tell you when you come you must send word when you will come so good bie walter dearL W Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 26 [December 1867]
